title: 'Purely an accident': Sharad Pawar rules out conspiracy in nephew Ajit's death; makes appeal
content: Veteran leader Sharad Pawar has dismissed conspiracy theories surrounding the tragic plane crash that claimed the life of his nephew, Ajit Pawar.  He emphasized that the incident was a pure accident, urging against any political exploitation of the tragedy. Ajit Pawar, a six-term Deputy Chief Minister, died en route to Baramati. Investigations are underway.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: What happened in 26 minutes and 5 unanswered questions
content: A Learjet 45 carrying Maharashtra's deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar crashed near Baramati runway after multiple landing attempts amid poor visibility. The aircraft burst into flames shortly after receiving landing clearance, raising questions about potential system failure, communication breakdown, or mechanical issues during the final approach.

title: 'My stomach sank': Ajit Pawar's account of 2024 chopper trip goes viral - watch
content: A 2024 video has resurfaced in which Ajit Pawar shared his mid-air scare experience with Devendra Fadnavis and Uday Samant. In the resurfaced video, the three ministers were flying form Nagpur to Gadchiroli to attend the foundation stone-laying ceremony of a steel plant. Addressing the gathering after their arrival, Pawar narrated how the helicopter entered thick cloud cover, leaving no visibility outside.

title: 'Next attack will be far worse': Trump's stern warning to Iran; Tehran rejects talks
content: US President Trump issued a stark warning to Iran, urging them to negotiate an "equitable" deal without nuclear weapons or face an attack far worse than "Operation Midnight Hammer." He reiterated claims of a massive "Armada" fleet heading towards Iran. Tehran rejected talks, deeming them impossible in an "atmosphere of threats," and stated that diplomacy cannot be effective under military pressure.

title: Amazon cuts 16,000 more jobs: Read HR head's email to employees
content: Amazon is cutting another 16,000 corporate jobs, bringing the total to 30,000, its largest workforce reduction ever. This move, driven by a massive $125 billion investment in AI and a push for greater efficiency, comes despite record profits. The company is also closing its Go and Fresh stores and discontinuing its palm-scanning payment system, signaling a significant strategic shift.

title: Inspired by Kapil Dev, how a Chandigarh coach produced two world-class all-rounders
content: From Kapil Dev to Yuvraj Singh and now Amanjot Kaur, Chandigarh has produced three World Cup-winning all-rounders. At the heart of the city’s latest success story is coach Nagesh Gupta, who nurtured Amanjot and Kashvee Gautam from raw bowlers into elite seam-bowling all-rounders, blending skill, resilience and a long-term vision.

title: Before 1st missiles fly: AI, cyber & electronic warfare - how India is preparing for invisible battlefields
content: India is strategically integrating AI, cyber, and electronic warfare into its military architecture, shifting from a platform-centric to a process-centric doctrine. This technological evolution, exemplified by Operation Sindoor, enhances intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance, aiming for strategic dominance and reduced reliance on foreign technology in future conflicts.

title: Baramati's bitter irony: The town that made 'dada' Ajit Pawar, then claimed him
content: Baramati, the Pawar family's political stronghold, witnessed the end of Ajit Pawar's political journey. The constituency that propelled his rise also became the site of his final chapter, where he decisively reaffirmed his dominance by defeating his grandnephew in a deeply personal electoral battle.

title: OpenAI VP Matt Knight resigns; shares 'note' sent to the company on Twitter; CEO Sam Altman replies
content: OpenAI's Chief Information Security Officer, Matt Knight, has resigned after over five years, having joined as the company's first security hire in 2020. Knight oversaw the development of OpenAI's security program, which now protects a global platform used by millions. He also led security product development, including the launch of Aardvark, before his departure.

title: Why Ishan Kishan is not playing 4th T20I: Suryakumar Yadav drops bombshell at toss
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and chose to bowl first against New Zealand in the fourth T20I. Having already secured the series 3-0, India aims to maintain momentum and refine their winning habits. Arshdeep Singh replaces the injured Ishan Kishan, who had a stellar series with the bat.

title: 'No one’s more deserving': Tom Brady reacts to Bill Belichick HOF snub
content: Bill Belichick's exclusion from the Pro Football Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility has sparked widespread debate. Tom Brady passionately defended his former coach, calling him the most deserving candidate ever. Despite Belichick's overwhelming career achievements, controversies may have influenced voters, raising questions about Hall of Fame standards.

title: Tesla Bull wants Apple CEO to resign: One reason is that company 'needs Google to survive'
content: Investor Ross Gerber has called for Apple CEO Tim Cook's resignation, criticizing the company's AI strategy and its reliance on Google's Gemini for Siri's next generation. Gerber argued Apple has "missed the AI boat" and is now dependent on Google to remain competitive. He also criticized Cook's attendance at a White House event, deeming it "bribery."

title: 'Runway in sight' ... then flames: How Ajit Pawar's jet went down - sequence of events
content: Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar's aircraft crashed near Baramati airport shortly after being cleared to land, killing all five on board. The aircraft, registered VI-SSK, had initiated a go-around earlier due to the runway not being in sight. Flames were observed near the runway threshold moments after the landing clearance.

title: Australia in Lahore for T20I series even as Pak await government nod for T20 WC
content: Australia's T20I squad has arrived in Lahore for a series against Pakistan, which serves as final preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup. However, Pakistan's participation in the tournament remains uncertain pending government approval, with a decision expected soon.  Several senior Australian players are resting for this series.

title: Emraan Hashmi says life changed overnight after son’s cancer diagnosis
content: Emraan Hashmi revealed that his life changed in 2014 when his son Ayaan was diagnosed with cancer. The painful five-year journey taught him patience, gratitude, and strength as a father. Now with his son healthy, Emraan focuses on gratitude and work, earning praise for his performance in the series 'Taskaree'.

title: Exclusive: Washington starts batting at BCCI CoE; India likely to play waiting game
content: India all-rounder Washington Sundar has resumed batting during his rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru but remains doubtful for the start of the T20 World Cup due to a rib injury. With tenderness persisting and limited off-spin options available, the team management is adopting a cautious approach before taking a final call.

title: Will Budget 2026 provide clarity on cryptocurrency taxation, simplify compliance?
content: India's booming crypto market, awaits clarity in Union Budget 2026. Following stringent measures in Budget 2025, including a 30% flat tax and 1% TDS, experts urge for nuanced rules on loss set-offs and asset classification. While some anticipate reforms, others foresee continued aggressive taxation, emphasizing compliance.

title: Jake Browning’s fiancée teases Super Bowl LX fit: ‘We’re going to the Bow’
content: Jake Browning’s fiancée Stephanie Niles teased a Super Bowl LX outfit on TikTok, saying she took inspiration from Kendall Jenner and planned to customize a silver, backless jumpsuit with team-name stickers. She did not reveal the team, but she celebrated the Seattle Seahawks’ NFC title win and wrote, “WE’RE GOING TO THE BOWL BABY!!!!!!”

title: Ajit Pawar death: Sule breaks down for her 'dada'; a bond beyond the NCP split
content: Supriya Sule broke down in tears upon learning of her cousin Ajit Pawar's death in a plane crash near Baramati. The tragedy occurred as Pawar was traveling to address rallies, casting a shadow over the recent political rift within the Pawar family and raising questions about the future of his NCP faction.

title: 'Hey Pak, don't come, you'll be thrashed': India World Cup-winner warns Mohsin Naqvi
content: Former India opener Krishnamachari Srikkanth has urged Pakistan to skip the T20 World Cup after PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi hinted at a potential withdrawal. Naqvi's remarks, made in solidarity with Bangladesh, drew a sharp response from Srikkanth, who warned Pakistan they would be comprehensively thrashed if they toured India.

title: UGC equity regulations 2026 decoded: How students can file a complaint and more
content: UGC’s 2026 equity regulations don’t set up a new 'campus court'. Instead, they make universities accountable through compliance: if an enquiry finds rules were ignored, UGC can bar an institution from schemes, degree programmes and ODL/online courses, and even remove it from recognised lists. Individual action is routed through existing campus rules, with police informed where criminal offences are indicated.

title: Novak Djokovic is playing on house money at the Australian Open
content: Novak Djokovic reached the Australian Open semifinals. His opponent, Lorenzo Musetti, retired hurt while leading two sets to love. Djokovic will now face Jannik Sinner in the last four. Sinner has won their last five encounters. Djokovic acknowledges Sinner as the favourite but is motivated for the match.

title: Carlos Alcaraz’s player box moment with DJ Peggy Gou turns heads
content: Carlos Alcaraz beat Alex de Minaur in straight sets at the 2026 Australian Open as DJ Peggy Gou watched from his player box. Days after their Seoul dinner, her presence caught attention in Melbourne. Alcaraz confirmed their friendship and said he hopes to reach the final to watch her perform at AO Live.

title: Blink and miss: Why cycling is ‘one of the hardest sports’ to commentate
content: Blink, and the race is gone. That’s the unique challenge of cycle racing, for spectators and commentators alike. At the Pune Grand Tour, India’s first UCI 2.2 event, commentators Ned Boulting and Graham Jones spoke about the complexities of cycling and the arduous task of talking about it to the viewers.

title: Ajit Pawar killed in Baramati plane crash — Who else was on board
content: A chartered Learjet 45 crashed at Baramati airport on Wednesday morning. Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar was among the five people on board who died. The flight had departed Mumbai earlier. It lost control during landing and caught fire. Investigations into the cause are underway. The victims included Pawar's security officer, an aircraft attendant, and the pilots.

title: No mayday call, runway not visible: DGCA reveals what went wrong on Ajit Pawar’s last flight
content: Pilots struggled to see the runway during a second landing attempt at Baramati before a fatal crash that killed Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others. The Learjet 45 aircraft, operated by VSR Ventures, made a go-around due to poor visibility. No Mayday call was issued by the crew.

title: Bangladesh-born team owner Tamim Rahman gets sentenced in match-fixing case
content: A Sri Lankan court handed a suspended prison sentence to Tamim Rahman, owner of the Dambulla Thunders, for match-fixing. Rahman, a British national, admitted to attempting to influence a player and arranging bets during the domestic T20 league. He received a four-year jail term, suspended for five years, and a hefty fine.

title: India-EU FTA: Why is the trade deal significant? Explained in 5 charts
content: India and the European Union have finalized a Free Trade Agreement. This pact will progressively lower tariffs on most goods. Indian consumers will see lower prices on items like chocolates and cars. Indian exporters will gain duty-free access to the EU market. The agreement also covers services and intellectual property rights.

title: Watch: Russian soldiers tied half naked to trees, forced to eat snow as punishment
content: Two Russian soldiers accused of desertion and disobeying orders were reportedly punished by being tied to a tree and forced to eat snow in freezing temperatures. The footage emerged amid ongoing peace talks, with Russia demanding territorial concessions from Ukraine, which Kyiv has rejected.

title: Ajit Pawar dies in plane crash: Who were the pilots in NCP chief's last flight?
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others died when a chartered Learjet 45 crash-landed at Baramati airport on Tuesday morning. The aircraft lost control during landing, striking the runway and catching fire. Investigations into the cause are underway, with weather conditions reported as good.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 6: Sunny Deol film touches Rs 200 cr in India
content: Border 2 has achieved a significant milestone crossing the Rs 200 crore mark. The film enjoyed a successful four-day extended weekend, boosted by its patriotic theme and Republic Day release. Opening with Rs 30 crore, it saw substantial growth, especially on Sunday and Monday, earning over Rs 50 crore on each of those days.

title: Peaking on time: India flex T20 WC muscle as SKY storms back into ICC top 10
content: India's T20 World Cup preparations are bolstered as captain Suryakumar Yadav re-enters the top 10 batting rankings. He joins Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma, giving India three batters in the elite group. Several other Indian players also saw significant jumps in the rankings, showcasing the team's strong batting depth ahead of the global tournament.

title: 4-lane MMR bridge near Mumbai suddenly narrows to 2; MMRDA denies design flaw
content: The recent construction of a Mira-Bhayander flyover is stirring controversy among local residents, who are voicing their frustrations over the unexpected reduction from four lanes to two. Many commuters are worried this change will exacerbate traffic congestion.

title: ‘Animals in a zoo’: Players unite against privacy invasion at Australian Open
content: Coco Gauff's post-match frustration at the Australian Open has ignited a unified player protest against perceived invasions of privacy.  Players, including Serena Williams and Iga Swiatek, are speaking out against constant off-court surveillance, likening it to being "animals in the zoo" and emphasising the need for personal space away from public view.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Riteish Deshmukh, Sanjay Dutt, Anupam Kher, Shilpa Shetty condole
content: On Wednesday, January 28, 2026, the Indian film industry joined the nation in mourning the sudden and tragic demise of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar. The senior NCP leader, along with four others, was killed when their charter aircraft crashed and burst into flames during a landing attempt at Baramati Airport in Pune district. Riteish Deshmukh, Sanjay Dutt, Anupam Kher, Shilpa Shetty, Madhur Bhandarkar, Shatrughan Sinha took to their social media handles to pay their respects.

title: 'Was willing to leave BJP': Mamata floats conspiracy theory on Ajit Pawar's death
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee alleged a political conspiracy behind the death of Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar in a plane crash. She demanded a Supreme Court-supervised probe, citing reports that Pawar was planning to rejoin his uncle Sharad Pawar's party. BJP MP Kangana Ranaut criticized Banerjee's statement as "petty" during a time of mourning.

title: Nam Saali, a film on rural education crisis, selected for BIFFES
content: The film highlights the pivotal role of government schools in sustaining rural society and preserving its social and cultural fabric

title: Woman’s death in Kozhikode: police to move custody application for accused
content: It was on January 24 that the 26-year-old woman was found dead inside Vaisakhan’s workshop at Malikkadavu

title: State taking all steps to prevent human deaths from elephant attacks: Forest Minister
content: Eshwar Khandre inspects the Shettihalli Wildlife Sanctuary as part of efforts to redraw its boundaries

title: Veteran trade union leader Anantha Subba Rao passes away
content: Associated with the All India Trade Union Congress his entire life, he was in the forefront of particularly the transport workers union in Karnataka

title: NIA raids nine locations in Kerala as part of probe against PFI
content: Case registered by National Investigation Agency in September 2022 accusing PFI of criminal conspiracy and acts to spread the idea of violent jihad in India with the aim of dismembering and taking over the country

title: Ed Lab formally inaugurated in Chitradurga
content: It has been set up with an objective of bringing meaningful and lasting change to the education ecosystem

title: DRDA commences work to lay forest road connecting hillock temple on Vellore-Tirupattur border
content: DRDA officials say the stretch would be laid between Poolankakuttai Road and Dharmakondaraja Koil Road, covering a distance of 2.6 km

title: A.P. Minister to visit UK, Qatar to study best practices for Amaravati Sports City project
content: The visit is intended to gain exposure to advanced urban planning models, sports infrastructure development, and global standards that can be adapted in Andhra Pradesh

title: International Theatre Festival of Kerala: Romeo and Juliet, reimagined in sweat, soil and laughter
content: Asterions Hus Theatre’s high-octane, physical comedy turns Shakespeare’s tragedy into a riotous celebration of love at ITFoK

title: Kudumbashree joins hands with distributors’ forum to market products
content: Kudumbashree existing products and those under K-INAM products will be sold through retail shops and supermarkets with supporters of All Kerala Distributors’ Association

title: Wings India 2026 day one: sky show steals the spotlight
content: An aerobatic display by UK pilots and a meticulously choreographed drone show turned the opening day of Wings India 2026 into a spectacle; from high-speed aerial manoeuvres to illuminated formations tracing India’s aviation story, the sky above Begumpet became a living canvas, blending technology, precision and narrative to close day one on a dramatic note

title: Person tested positive for KFD infection dies
content: Kyasanur Forest Disease, a viral infection, is also known as monkey fever, as monkeys also get infected

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27 to be presented on Thursday
content: Budget constitutes the final one of the present Left Democratic Front government, as Kerala is scheduled to have the Assembly elections in a few months' time

title: Coalition government has turned A.P. into ‘Jungle Raj’, alleges Jagan
content: Education, healthcare, and agriculture sectors have been weakened, while welfare schemes promised during the elections have either been diluted or discontinued, alleges the former Chief Minister

title: CITU appeals to Mysuru residents to support Feb. 12 bandh
content: The strike demands the repeal of the four Labour Codes and the withdrawal of the VB G RAM G Act 2025, SHANTI Act 2025, Seed Act 2025, and Sabka Suraksha Sabka Bheema Act 2025, along with secure, decent employment and statutory minimum wages

title: No agreement reached between DMK and Congress
content: Sources said DMK’s Kanimozhi and Congress’s Rahul Gandhi held “discussions on issues that need to be resolved”. However, the number of seats for the Congress did not figure in the meeting

title: Mamkootathil granted bail, released from jail
content: He was freed from the Mavelikara Sub-Jail amid protests by Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha activists outside the prison

title: NHRC discusses human rights violations arising from re-verification of certificates of govt. employees with disabilities
content: NHRC chairperson recommends scrutiny only to cases of a specific suspicion instead of mass re-verification of all employees with disability

title: Two-day Digi Photo Expo 2026 in Hubballi from Saturday
content: The Karnataka Video and Photo Association is organising the 11th edition of the expo at Vasavi Mahal

title: EU FTA puts India on a level playing field against competitors in labour-intensive sectors: chief negotiator
content: Chief negotiator Darpan Jain also said that, apart from an overall benefit to all States, the FTA provides sectoral benefits to several States such as Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Gujarat, Maharashtra, among others

title: Delays dog PMJVK education infra for minorities in Telangana; govt. says hurdles overcome
content: Official data shows that of the 92 infrastructure units approved under the scheme — primarily buildings intended to house educational institutions — only 41 have been completed so far

title: Delhi High Court asks for DGCA’s response on norms for pilot rest
content: The revised Flight Duty Time Limitation norms, put on hold following large-scale flight disruptions in late 2025, are aimed at improving flight safety by limiting the flying hours of pilots and other crew members

title: Delhi HC dismisses Engineer Rashid's plea challenging framing of charges in terror funding case
content: "The present appeal would also not be maintainable and is dismissed as being not maintainable," says the Bench

title: Police launch ‘Dhairya Sparsha’ initiative in Chittoor
content: The initiative will be intensified by covering all the girls’ schools and hostels in the district in a phased manner, says Additional SP

title: Ahead of Mahashivaratri and Ugadi, M.M. Hills to get upgraded facilities for devotees
content: Home guards to assist police and forest personnel in securing the padayatra route following a recent leopard attack

title: ‘VB-G RAM G Act will curtail corruption that prevailed under the repealed MGNREGA’
content: Investigation has detected ₹290 crore irregularities in the earlier MGNREGA, says Rajya Sabha member Iranna Kadadi

title: Karnataka govt. favourable to declaring Tulu as official language: Minister
content: ‘Official team has visited West Bengal and Andhra Pradesh to study the second official language models followed in those States’

title: UGC rules row: BJP functionary quits, man writes letter in blood to PM as protests intensify in Uttar Pradesh
content: In Deoria, thousands of people staged a sit-in on the district court premises, raising slogans against the Centre and the State Government

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Neighbours remember affable nature of security officer Jadhav, victim of Baramati air crash
content: Jadhav, a long-time resident of Vitawa, is survived by his parents, a 14-year-old daughter, and a nine-year-old son

title: New Kendriya Vidyalaya to open in Chittoor from 2026-27
content: The school is among the 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas sanctioned by the Union government in October 2025 under the civil sector

title: Ajit Pawar: Long political life marked by drama, rebellions, and scams
content: A man who had felt sidelined and wronged by his own family patriarch, and who had tied over struggles to maintain his political position

title: Security forces recover arms & ammunition from forest area near LoC in J&K’s Kupwara
content: The recoveries, which included four pistols, seven magazines, three AK magazines and 308 AK-47 rounds, were made during a search operation in the Rati Tari forest area of Karnah tehsil

title: Meghalaya group seeks clarity on 1948 merger with India
content: The Hynñiewtrep Integrated Territorial Organisation said the issue concerns “national solemn commitments” made to the Khasi States at the time of accession

title: MUDA case: Bengaluru special court accepts ‘B’ report filed by Lokayukta police giving clean chit to Siddaramaiah and wife Parvathi
content: The Court delivered the verdict while rejecting the protest petition filed by complainant Snehamayi Krishna who had questioned the outcome of the investigation conducted by the Lokayukta police.

title: Ajit Pawar's funeral on January 29; Modi, Shah likely to attend
content: The Maharashtra government declared a public holiday on Wednesday (January 28, 2026) and announced a three-day period of State mourning

title: President invokes Gandhi and Nehru, urges MPs to act as one in national interest
content: President Droupadi Murmu said the government was accelerating the “reform express” for achieving a developed India by 2047

title: Kochi Corporation to re-engage NIT for fresh assessment of legacy waste at Brahmapuram
content: Decision taken at a council meeting while considering an agenda seeking administrative and financial sanction to extend contract with Bhumi Green Energy for bio-mining excess quantity of legacy waste

title: Kochi Corporation’s new mosquito eradication force draws LDF ridicule
content: Kochi Mayor defends the move, stressing that mosquito eradication is the top priority among 21 projects announced the UDF governing committee as part of its 50-day action plan

title: Is Karnataka Governor’s phone being tapped, asks BJP, as Congress accuses him of taking instructions from Centre
content: This question came in response to Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil stating that Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot had been ‘receiving instructions from New Delhi over the phone’

title: Macaulay’s conspiracies instilled sense on inferiority among Indians: President Murmu
content: President Murmu made a reference to British official Macaulay and his policies during the colonial rule in the 19th century

title: Last moments of aircraft carrying Pawar: multiple landing attempts, go-around, clearance, then crash
content: Baramati has an `uncontrolled airfield', and traffic information is provided by the instructors/pilots from the Flying Training Organisations at Baramati. The aircraft VI-SSK first came in contact at 8:18 a.m., as per the Baramati Air Traffic Control (ATC)

title: A chopper crash that changed the political landscape of united Andhra Pradesh
content: The tragic death of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar in a plane crash brings back memories of YSR’s death; after his passing, Congress lost its hold in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, KCR revived TRS and Jaganmohan Reddy emerged as a force to reckon with

title: ‘Flying to Baramati, will talk tomorrow’: Attendant’s father recalls her last words
content: “Pappa, I am flying to Baramati tomorrow (Wednesday) with DCM Ajit Pawar. After dropping him, I will go to Nanded and will speak to you once I reach the hotel…” Shivkumar Mali said, recounting his last conversation with his daughter Pinky Mali, an attendant killed in the Baramati plane crash

title: Recycled ritual, replete with hollow promises: Congress slams Govt after President address in Parliament
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said the Viksit Bharat slogan is repeated loudly, "yet it has no clear goals, timelines and measurable outcomes"

title: Petitioners submit 88% not received notices in TN as objections phase ends on January 30, SC schedules urgent hearing on January 29
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal, representing the petitioners, suggests that the court should extend the directions issued in the January 19 order in the West Bengal SIR case to Tamil Nadu as well.

title: Ajit Pawar: Sharad Pawar’s shadow to Fadnavis’ ally, a look at his 40-year political journey
content: Rising from his uncle’s shadow to openly challenging his authority, Ajit Pawar emerged as Maharashtra’s most enduring Deputy Chief Minister

title: Gautham Menon interview: 25 years in films, and how ‘Dhruva Natchathiram’ became a lesson in management
content: This February, Gautham Menon completes 25 years in the industry. The Tamil filmmaker talks about his memorable journey, how music has played a vital role in it and why fans can look forward to ‘Dhruva Natchathiram’ soon

title: Export of marine products from Kerala dipped for second consecutive year in 2024-25: Economic Review
content: Tariff barriers, non-tariff barriers, including antibiotic rejection, biosecurity and sustainability issues, imposition of ban on wild-caught shrimps imported from India due to non-implementation of Turtle Excluder Device by the U.S. etc, are reasons for decrease in marine exports, according to the Economic Review

title: Wetzel: Belichick's first-ballot bid was a no-brainer
content: The humiliation of snubbing Bill Belichick is on the committee and, in turn, on the Hall of Fame itself.

title: Sources: Belichick not a 1st-ballot Hall of Famer
content: Bill Belichick, the eight-time Super Bowl-winning coach, will not be a first-ballot Hall of Famer, sources told ESPN.

title: Mensah commits to Miami after Duke settlement
content: Darian Mensah and Duke have agreed to a settlement of their dispute that cleared the way for the quarterback's transfer to Miami.

title: Wembanyama 'horrified' by Minnesota shootings
content: Spurs star Victor Wembanyama on Tuesday articulated his thoughts on a pair of fatal shootings by federal agents in Minneapolis, saying, "Every day I wake up and see the news and I'm horrified."

title: Djokovic, down 2 sets, advances when Musetti hurt
content: Novak Djokovic will play in his 13th Australian Open semifinal after his opponent, Lorenzo Musetti, retired from their match while leading the 24-time major champion 6-4, 6-3, 1-3.

title: Broncos fire OC Lombardi after falling short of SB
content: Broncos offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi was fired Tuesday along with wide receivers coach Keary Colbert and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch.

title: Nebraska's 24-game win streak ends vs. Michigan
content: Nebraska's improbable run, the longest in Division I since since Gonzaga reeled off 35 in a row between 2019 and 2021, came to a halt against the No. 3 Wolverines.

title: Rodman, Hayes viral celebration caps off U.S. rout
content: Trinity Rodman capped off the USWNT's 5-0 rout of Chile by coaxing coach Emma Hayes into a sideline dance, as a young American squad secured its fifth consecutive shutout Tuesday night.

title: Sinner ends another Grand Slam run for Shelton
content: Jannik Sinner was all business in a 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 win over eighth-seeded Ben Shelton to extend his winning streak at the Australian Open to 19.

title: 🏈 Connelly's top 100 games of 2025 CFB season
content: From CFP (and FCS playoff) classics to OT thrillers and what-the-heck moments, this season had it all.

title: Our updated NFL free agent 1-50 ranking, six weeks out: Two quarterbacks? Seven wide receivers?
content: Could George Pickens, Breece Hall and Malik Willis land big contracts? Here are the top 50 free agents heading into the offseason.

title: Biggest looming free agent decisions for every team: What's next for George Pickens, others?
content: NFL free agency starts on March 11. What does the future look like for these 32 soon-to-be free agents?

title: When football meets third grade curriculum: The rise of NFeLementary
content: Mary Crippen, a third grade educator based in Florida, built NFeLementary by expanding on a football-based curriculum her mother created decades earlier.

title: The Lakers, the Cavaliers and LeBron's most dominant season ever
content: There are many similarities between this Lakers team and its season and the Cavaliers in 2017-18, which James says remains the best campaign of his illustrious career. He returns to Cleveland on Wednesday night.

title: WWE 'Raw' results: Finn Balor attacks CM Punk, Bron Breakker returns
content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: Best of Day 1 at the Senior Bowl: Which draft prospects turned the most heads on Tuesday?
content: Here are the top NFL draft risers from the first day of Senior Bowl practices, where the defensive line class stood out.

title: Bills stay in-house with Joe Brady hire for head coach. Why, and what's next?
content: If change was needed to get the Bills over the Super Bowl hump, how does bringing in someone tied to past failures accomplish that?

title: Women's Bracketology: How a new metric will help (or hurt) bubble teams
content: Understanding wins above bubble helps explain why Virginia, which has a 37 NET ranking, is on the outside looking in.

title: Four offseason lessons from two unlikely Super Bowl teams: Savvy moves for the Seahawks, Patriots
content: It's easy to be skeptical about big free agency spending, midtier QB contracts and defensive-minded coaches. But the Seahawks and Patriots proved everyone wrong.

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: The three key factors that helped the Avalanche turn into a juggernaut
content: Colorado is flirting with NHL records for team performance. We dive deep on the NHL's most dominant team.

title: How to reach the Champions League knockouts: Can Man City, Chelsea avoid the playoff round?
content: We're less than a week away from knowing which 24 teams advance from the league phase. Here's what's at stake with only one matchweek to go.

title: How to bet the Farmers Insurance Open: English, Matsuyama set up for success
content: The third stop of the PGA Tour brings us to San Diego, where scoring could be hard to come by at Torrey Pines.

title: Bobby Marks' NBA trade deadline guide: What to know about all 30 teams
content: What deals could kick-start the NBA trade deadline? Bobby Marks examines the players, picks and priorities you need to know for all 30 teams.

title: What went wrong for Coco Gauff at the Australian Open
content: Elina Svitolina was able to upset No. 3 Coco Gauff in less than an hour on Tuesday night. Here's how she did it.

title: 'Bulldoze these guys': Alexander Volkanovski's vow after 2,996 days of waiting
content: By the time Alexander Volkanovski makes his Octagon walk on Sunday, it will be 2,996 days since he last fought in Sydney. A lot has changed since then, but a late-career lingering UFC narrative remains a constant.

title: Benny the Bull picks new number after Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey retirement
content: Benny had worn No. 1 since 1969. In honor of Rose's jersey retirement, the beloved mascot enters a new era.

title: Marco Rubio Warns Venezuela Of New Military Action If Expectations Not Met
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans on Wednesday to warn that the Trump administration is ready to take new military action against Venezuela if the country's interim leadership strays from US expectations.

title: PM Modi Likely To Visit Israel In February To Deepen Strategic Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Israel in February, giving a fresh push to the rapidly expanding strategic partnership between the two countries, Israel's Ambassador to India Reuven Azar has hinted to NDTV.

title: How Ajit Pawar Plane Crash Sends Tremors Through Maharashtra Politics
content: The ruling Mahayuti in Maharashtra, battling disagreements and recovering from an acrimonious campaign for the local body polls, has been dealt its most devastating blow yet.

title: Bhopal Slaughterhouse Trail: Power, Protection And Beef That Shook The System
content: The sealed slaughterhouse in Bhopal's Jinsi area has prompted many more unsettling questions than alleged cow slaughter alone.

title: "Next Attack Will Be Far Worse": Trump's Latest Threat To Iran
content: US President Donald Trump appeared on Wednesday to threaten another attack on Iran if it does not "make a deal" on nuclear weapons, after Tehran rejected talks.

title: Pilot Shambhavi Pathak Among 5 Dead In Plane Crash That Killed Ajit Pawar
content: Shambhavi Pathak was operating the VSR Ventures Learjet 45, registered as VT-SSK, along with Pilot Captain Sumit Kapur.

title: Ten Minutes From Kanpur, The Plane Crash That Killed Madhavrao Scindia
content: On September 30, 2001, the Congress lost one of its brightest leaders, Madhavrao Scindia, in a plane crash 10 minutes from Kanpur

title: Ajit Pawar's Last Rites To Be Performed At 11 Am In Baramati Tomorrow

title: PM Modi Speaks To Sharad Pawar, Condoles Ajit Pawar's Death
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to NCP-SP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday and expressed condolences at the death of his nephew, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

title: "Papa, I'm Flying With Ajit Pawar To Baramati": Crew Member's Last Call To Father
content: Ajit Pawar Death: The final phone conversation between flight attendant Pinky Mali and her father, Shivkumar Mali, has emerged following the Baramati plane crash that claimed the lives of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others.

content: Amazon is slashing about 16,000 corporate jobs in the second round of mass layoffs for the ecommerce company in three months.

content: The visibility at Baramati airport was poor when the aircraft carrying Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar crashed on Wednesday morning.

title: Wetzel: Let football be football. And let it snow.
